steps.title: Soak the rice and urad dal in separate bowls for at least 4 hours.
steps.content: Soak the rice and urad dal in separate bowls for at least 4 hours. These will be later ground together to make a batter which ferments for 6 hours or more. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Grind the soaked items separately.
steps.content: Grind the soaked items separately. This is best done with a stone grinder, but a high powered blender can also do the job (although the batter will be somewhat more coarse in texture). [2] X Research source Grind the soaked rice. Grind the soaked urad dal.

steps.title: Mix the ground rice and urad dal together.
steps.content: Mix the ground rice and urad dal together.

steps.title: Set aside in a warm place to ferment for 8 hours.
steps.content: Set aside in a warm place to ferment for 8 hours. Use a crock pot on the "keep warm" setting or an oven on the "proof" setting if you live in an area where the ambient temperature is below 75 °F (24 °C). [3] X Research source

steps.title: Spoon the batter into the plates.
steps.content: Spoon the batter into the plates.

steps.title: Set the idli steamer into a large, pre heated pot with water in the bottom for steaming.
steps.content: Set the idli steamer into a large, pre heated pot with water in the bottom for steaming.

steps.title: Steam the batter for 5-10 minutes or until fluffy.
steps.content: Steam the batter for 5-10 minutes or until fluffy.

steps.title: Remove the idlis from the steamer and serve warm with Chutney, or Sambhar.
steps.content: Remove the idlis from the steamer and serve warm with Chutney, or Sambhar. [4] X Research source
